author: randomishwalk
content:
Yeah this was an excellent post. Increasingly coming to the conclusion (maybe slower than everyone here) that MEV is something to manage + goal is to design market mechanisms to re-distribute rather than eliminate. 

There's a curious trade-off here between permissionless-ness vs. magnitude of MEV externality. Worry that mechanisms that attempt to "eliminate it" end up re-creating the permissioned, infrastructure arms-race (via colocation, better networking etc) we've seen in traditional exchange venues. IEX (you may have heard of it from Flash Boys) for example introduces a speed bump in an attempt to level the playing field: https://www.wealthmanagement.com/markets/iex-outduels-citadel-nyse-flash-boys-exchange-approved
